title: Add menu to report bug and rendering issues
body:
# Issue details

### Duplicate?
Have you searched the issues of this repository if your issue is already known? yes

### Actual behaviour
When I find a bug (including this one, how meta) or something reportable (such as a content rendering issue), I need to go to the github page manually, and create a bug there.

### Expected behaviour
It would be good to have a direct link to the new issue template, ideally prepopulated with environment details and logs

# Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Find a bug, or rendering issue
2. Go to the side menu of the app in search of a “report issue”, or “report rendering issue” in article view
3. Can't find
4. Open the browser to  https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/new manually, and be sad

# Environment details
- **wallabag app version**: 2.0.2 (106)
- **wallabag app installation source** (e.g. Gplay, F-Droid, manual): F-Droid
- **Android OS version**: 7.1.2
- **Android ROM** (e.g. stock, LineageOS, SlimRom,…): LineageOS 14.1
- **Android hardware**: Hammerhead
- **wallabag server version**: 2.3.2
- **Do you have Two-Factor-Authentication enabled?**: no
# Your experience with wallabag Android app

Have you had any luck using wallabag Android app before? (Sometimes we get tired of reading bug reports all day and a lil' positive end note does wonders)

Yup, works great :+1:

title: Wallabag Service Not Found - Check URL (in Android App)
label: [Label(name="Bug"), Label(name="Easy")]
body:
# Issue details

### Duplicate?
Have you searched the issues of this repository if your issue is already known? Yes, and I found it several times, but old or not matching issues. Like #737 and #495.

### Actual behaviour
- Cannot log into Wallabag using the Android app, works with browsers, Wallabagger Chrome addon and also iOS app.

### Expected behaviour
- Login working with Android app also.

# Steps to reproduce the issue
1. I try to login into Wallabag through Android app
2. "Wallabag Service Not Found - Check URL" appears

# Environment details
- **wallabag app version**: 2.0.2
- **wallabag app installation source**: Gplay
- **Android OS version**: 8.1.0
- **Android ROM**: Stock ROM
- **Android hardware**: Xiaomi Mi A2
- **wallabag server version**: Github origin/master (up-to-date, made "git pull" today), self hosted server, HTTPS, did not activate minify
- **Do you have Two-Factor-Authentication enabled?**: no

# Logs
## Web server
pxxxxxxxx.dip0.t-ipconnect.de - - [12/Nov/2018:11:25:41 +0100] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 302 5386 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
pxxxxxxxx.dip0.t-ipconnect.de - - [12/Nov/2018:11:25:41 +0100] "GET /login HTTP/1.1" 200 1932 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"

# Your experience with wallabag Android app
It worked without problems with Wallabag v1, but this is quite a while ago. As I cannot even log into the server I cannot say more about the app at the moment.

# Special Setup here
I am rewriting the urls to let it look nice. I do not want to see the web directory here. Also I disabled the register page as I do not want to have people registering accounts on my instance here.
The following setup is used in the Apache webserver:

RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^wallabag\.domain\.tld$ [NC]
RewriteRule !^web/ /web%{REQUEST_URI} [L,NC]
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ app.php [QSA,L]
<FilesMatch ".*register$">
Order Allow,Deny
Deny from all
</FilesMatch>

I am happy to provide further information about my setup, problem, whatsoever. Unfortunally the lack of a working Android client stops me using Wallabag at all. I need to get it working. :-)

title: Android app empty, while server is full of article
body:
Android app : 2.02 (106)
Wallabag server: 2.3.2

After having manually transferred data from the android app to a fresh installation of Wallabag, I'm not able anymore to display anything in the android application. The application stays empty.
First time I synchronized (after fresh server installation and this manual importation), all articles disappeared. Now, if I'm able to *add* a new article, it never show up on Android app, but it appears in the Wallabag server web page.

How can I clean this mess, keeping my article list safe?
Thanks!

title: WIP: added autohiding statusbar with scrollView.SetOnScrollChangeListener()
body:
This addresses [#114](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/114). I have tried to add the auto-hide functionality to the action bar by using scrollView.setOnScrollChangeListener(). I tried to do it with the webViewContent, but due to its nesting within the scrollview, it was really buggy. 

The only issue I can see is that when the bar is showing/hiding, there is artificating at the bottom of  the screen.

The system status bar doesn't get hidden, but I believe that would be relatively simple to implement.

On a side note, when playing around with the fling gestures to switch articles, I found that they were pretty unreliable. Changing them to apply on the scrollView seemed to make them much more reliable but this isn't something I've tested or fully understand...I am an android development newbie.

title: Improve readability of wide content
body:
# Issue details

### Duplicate?
Have you searched the issues of this repository if your issue is already known? yes

### Actual behaviour
Look at content that is wider than the screen, e.g.:
- a wide `<pre>`(?) like <https://lkml.org/lkml/2018/9/16/167>
- tables from wikipedia like at <https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Worte_des_Vorsitzenden_Mao_Tsetung#Struktur_und_Inhalt>

Such content is not squeezed to fit into the screen width, instead one can scroll horizontally to see all of it.
However, the scrolling is difficult because swiping to much to the left goes to the next article.

### Expected behaviour
Either squeeze the content (which might look bad) or [offer to] disable going the the next article by swiping. Maybe there's some other solution, too.

# Environment details
- **wallabag app version**: 1.0.2 (106)
- **wallabag app installation source**: f-droid
- **Android OS version**: 7.1
- **Android ROM** (e.g. stock, LineageOS, SlimRom,…): custom, LineageOS 
- **Android hardware**: golden / Galaxy S3mini
- **wallabag server version**: 2.3.1


# Your experience with wallabag Android app
Have you had any luck using wallabag Android app before?

Yes, works great, thank you!

title: Add German translation for last update string
Exception when syncing big website in wallabag
body:
# Issue details

When adding a big website (i.e. https://norvig.com/big.txt ) to wallabag, I get a "Server error" notification with the exception `com.di72nn.stuff.wallabag.apiwrapper.exceptions.UnsuccessfulResponseException` and the text "HTTP response: 500 Internal Server Error"

### Duplicate?
Have you searched the issues of this repository if your issue is already known? yes

### Actual behaviour
- Tell us what happens

See the issue details.

### Expected behaviour
- Tell us what should happen

There should be a notification that clarifies what went wrong, not an exception. Maybe there shouldn't be a notification at all. 

# Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Add https://norvig.com/big.txt to the wallabag server ( I used the share option in Opera on my phone to do this)
2. Start syncing on the phone
3. Get the exception
Note: After a random amount of retries, the article will be downloaded to the phone. However, the website gets downloaded without any content. I don't know if this is a problem with the content fetcher, as the item doesn't have any text on the server too. 

# Environment details
- **wallabag app version**: 2.0.2-DEBUG (106)
- **wallabag app installation source** (e.g. Gplay, F-Droid, manual): GitHub Master
- **Android OS version**: 7.1.2
- **Android ROM** (e.g. stock, LineageOS, SlimRom,…): LineageOS
- **Android hardware**: Moto G2 (thea)
- **wallabag server version**: 2.2.3


# Logs
## wallabag server
Please paste relevant wallabag server logs here (from file `<wallabag>/var/logs/prod.log`):


## Web server
Please paste relevant web server logs (e.g. from nginx, Apache, …) here:
Nothing was written in var/logs/prod.log.
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here!


# Your experience with wallabag Android app
Have you had any luck using wallabag Android app before? (Sometimes we get tired of reading bug reports all day and a lil' positive end note does wonders)
Yup, works super fine when it is set up :) Never had any critical issues.

title: update dependencies and NotificationCompat support library
Adaptive icon support
body:
This adds the new icon from #638 but now with support for adaptive icons on devices running Android 8.0 or higher. The new icon in the shape of a rounded square is used as the legacy icon to be shown on devices running older versions of Android.

The icons have been moved from the `drawables` directories to `mipmap` directories as recommended [here](https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2014/10/getting-your-apps-ready-for-nexus-6-and.html).

This is what the new icon looks like on legacy devices:  

![ic_launcher](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/40596525-1be9cf44-6259-11e8-9472-495e2e53dcb5.png)

The adaptive icon looks different depending upon the mask used by the launcher or selected by the user:  
![screenshot_2018-05-28 adapticon 4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/40596586-901187fe-6259-11e8-8cfb-32cf0e4e1c30.png)
![screenshot_2018-05-28 adapticon 5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/40596587-9077c1cc-6259-11e8-907d-b5ccb5c8457b.png)
![screenshot_2018-05-28 adapticon 6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/40596588-90b497d2-6259-11e8-837c-721ad25eba74.png)
![screenshot_2018-05-28 adapticon 7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/40596590-90f4e33c-6259-11e8-82d7-0f3eaa2bfdb5.png)

As discussed earlier, we'll need to add credits for Michael Cook in About. 
I hope it is okay to have updated the readme icon as well in this same PR.

We will need to build against SDK 26 in order to support adaptive icons though we *don't need* to target API 26.

title: Wrong sort order
label: [Label(name="Bug"), Label(name="Needs to be reproduced")]
body:
Hi

Using 2.0.2 app on Lollipop and 2.3.2 on the server side.

Everything seems to work except that  the sort order is shown oldest to newest when the app is open. But the newly added article (either via the app or the server) shown at the top as the first one which is expected but the second article at the top is the oldest article ever bagged.

The weird thing is that if I reverse the article sort order using the ui button, the newly added article is not show anymore however the order is almost equal to how server web ui list the articles except that the newly added article is not shown at the top.

thanks

title: Set origin_url when adding articles from an article
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
When you click on a link in an article, wallabag offers you two options: _add to wallabag_ or _open in browser_.

It could be cool to forward the original article url when clicking _add to wallabag_ using the field `original_url`.

title: Configure if dynamic content should be automatically played
body:
I use wallabag android app in a device with electronic ink. Screen refresh in e-ink devices is really slow, making impossible to see dynamic content like animated GIFs or videos. I've got a couple of times wallabag crashing because of that. In general with videos if the device is not connected to the network they don't reproduce (as they are not in cache). But gifs usually get cached and reproduced automatically.

The latest example I have is https://blog.cloudflare.com/announcing-1111/ . This will crash wallabag everytime I open it in my device, I'm assuming because the animated gif that is recognized as the main image of the article.

Will be great if there will be a configuration option to block automatic reproduction of dynamic content.

title: tts: automatic switch to article's language
body: Use the "language" attribute of articles to automatically switch TTS language.

title: Notification channels not implemented
body: Syncing on Oreo causes a toast message to appear, saying "failed to post notification on channel 'null'". This is likely caused by wallabag not yet supporting notification channels as required by api level 26.

title: Erreur : okhttp3.internal.http2.StreamResetException: stream was reset : INTERNAL_ERROR
body:
Hello,

I have the following error when I try to synchronize the app with my own wallabag server : `okhttp3.internal.http2.StreamResetException: stream was reset : INTERNAL_ERROR`
The issue might not be due to my server because a friend doesn't have the same problem on the same server (just not the same account)
The difference are our phones and our android versions. I have an honor 7 with android 6.0 and my friend has a Samsung S7 with android 7.0.

The first synchronization works well but when I try to refresh, I get this error.

Thank you for your help,

Alexis.

title: On slow internet, Mark article as read action is blocking UI
label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="Question")]
body:
When i am on a real unresponsive, slow internet network connection (2G) and i hit the button to mark an article as ready the UI is frozen until the article is marked as read. In the meantime Android system suggests to wait or close the app. If you wait, some more seconds later the article is marked as read and you can go on using the app.

Is there any improvement in this issue when #621 is implemented?

title: "DELETE /api/entries/100.json HTTP/1.1" 403
body:
Hi, I am having problems in updating entries/adding/removing entries in wallabag android app v 2.0.2 (F-Droid release). In the server, I have enabled **apache-ultimate-badbot-blocker** and **modsecurity** with default settings before having this problem, logging has also been disabled in the server before this happened so this may be happening a while before I even installed those security tools. I have also tested wallabag after removing those two tools but it is still not working.

Here is the error in the server log: (apache)
**xxxx.net - - [11/Mar/2018:13:26:12 +0800] "DELETE /api/entries/100.json HTTP/1.1" 403 610 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"**

in the android app:
**Error: Unknown Error: Error:com.di72nn.stuff.wallabag.apiwrapper.exceptions.UnsuccessfulResponseException:HTTP response: 403 Forbidden**

I also harden my Apache server by using **X-XSS protection**, **x-frame-options sameorigin**, and others. I am using SSL own instance of wallabag, the API can get new keys and client_ids but whenever I add/remove article, refresh it then it shows 403 error. I have the Require all granted in the wallabag.conf in the server.

After wiping the database of my android app wallabag, I can see the new articles I used in the web extension/addon of wallabag. But I cannot add new articles in the app unless I wipe the database and perform fullupdate again.

title: Connection test doesn't use https even when specifying https
body:
Hi,

so this issue refernces addresses the famous "wallabag service not found" error. I just installed the android app and pointed it to my instance, but it failed to connect.

I'm using a fresh docker instance and apache to reverse proxy (I know, I know). Since I use acme.sh to get Let's Encrypt certificates, all calls to http://*.mydomain.tld point to the same static html. That means "http**s**://wallabag.mydomain.tld" points to the real Wallabag instance and "http://wallabag.mydomain.tld" points to a static html file which of course can't be parsed by the app.

In the Android app, even when I specifically set the wallabag-URL to http**s**://wallabag.mydomain.tld, it requests the non-https version from my server and can't connect. I solved this for be by adding a static redirect for http://wallabag.mydomain.tld to http**s**://wallabag.mydomain.tld, which breaks acme.sh compatibility but works for the android app. I know that I can just disable this redirect again after setting the app once, but it took me quite a while to figure this out and I think this is undesired behaviour.

So I think this issue needs to be addressed so that the Android app really uses http**s** when asked to.

Thank you!

title: PROTOCOL_ERROR when updating articles
body:
Hi,

Application side: Wallabag 2.0.2 (106) app installed via FDroid on Android 7.1.2 (LineageOS)
Server side: Wallabag 2.2.3 running on Debian 9 Stretch with Nginx 1.10.3 (HTTP/2 support enabled by default)


When I try to update articles on the wallabag 2.0.2 (106) app, I have sometimes the following error:
> Erreur: okhttp3.internal.http2.StreamResetException: stream was reset: PROTOCOL_ERROR

**Edit:
Solution: in my case, it was due to the setting `http2_max_field_size` set to a too low value by default in nginx's configuration.
Using `http2_max_field_size 16k; http2_max_header_size 32k;` in my configuration solved the issue.**



I am not absolutely sure that it is a wallabag error _per se_, as a similar issue was reported some time ago on okhttp's repository (https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/1897) and it was an incompatibility of some kind between okhttp and nginx 1.9.5. However, I am running nginx 1.10.3 (with http2 support) and I checked in the package's sources that the fix (http://hg.nginx.org/nginx/rev/0e37389c0bd5) had actually been implemented.

My Nginx logs:

> [05/Dec/2017:22:58:43] "GET /api/entries.json?sort=updated&page=1&order=asc&since=1512483516&perPage=30 HTTP/2.0" 401 278 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
[05/Dec/2017:22:58:43] "POST /oauth/v2/token HTTP/2.0" 200 358 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
[05/Dec/2017:22:58:43] "GET /api/entries.json?sort=updated&page=1&order=asc&since=1512483516&perPage=30 HTTP/2.0" 200 534 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
[05/Dec/2017:22:58:43] "GET /api/entries.json?sort=created&page=1&order=desc&since=0&perPage=1 HTTP/2.0" 200 6301 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
**[05/Dec/2017:22:58:44] "-" 000 0 "-" "-"
[05/Dec/2017:22:58:44] "-" 000 0 "-" "-"**
[05/Dec/2017:23:16:41] "GET /api/entries.json?sort=updated&page=1&order=asc&since=1512483516&perPage=30 HTTP/2.0" 200 534 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
[05/Dec/2017:23:16:41] "GET /api/entries.json?sort=created&page=1&order=desc&since=0&perPage=1 HTTP/2.0" 200 6301 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
**[05/Dec/2017:23:16:41] "-" 000 0 "-" "-"
[05/Dec/2017:23:16:41] "-" 000 0 "-" "-"**
[05/Dec/2017:23:16:55] "GET /api/tags.json HTTP/2.0" 200 388 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
[05/Dec/2017:23:16:55] "GET /api/entries.json?sort=created&page=1&order=asc&since=0&perPage=30 HTTP/2.0" 200 295182 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"

The `"-" 000 0 "-" "-"` entries seem to match pretty well when the android app is showing the error.

Do you have any idea what the problem could be or how I could give you more information about the issue?

Thanks!

Since 2.0.2 the apps targets API level 26, which may have some not easily noticeable consequences (even for pre-Android-8 devices).

For example, the app may have problem [with broadcasts](https://developer.android.com/guide/components/broadcast-exceptions.html).

title: update gradle to 3.0.1 and wrapper to 4.1
fullscreen article view
body:
This pull request implements a fullscreen article view (i.e., it Android's system bar and the SupportActionBar are hided during article reading) as suggested in #114. The feature is toggable via an app-setting (in contrast to react on a tap as suggested in #569 ).

This pull request also fixes #636, by only reacting on `KeyEvent.ACTION_UP` instead of `KeyEvent.ACTION_DOWN`, given [that `AppCompatActivity` catches the key down events.](https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/support/+/refs/heads/master/v7/appcompat/src/android/support/v7/app/AppCompatActivity.java#567)
(I'm not entirely sure whether this is the true reason, but the fix works for me.)

title: image cache: mark as nomedia
body:
Perhaps a duplicate of #640. The cached images show up in the stock AOSP gallery, making a bit of a mess.

The image cache, or maybe the whole application data directory should be marked as non-media (e.g, by adding a `.nomedia` file in it), to prevent indexation.

title: image cache: mark as android cache
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Android 4.4 here with the app v2.0.1 (105) from f-droid. I tried the image cache, but then realized it uses too much SD card space (due to #601 ). I disabled the option, which did not delete the cache (ok for me) but looking at Android settings > Apps > wallabag I could see that the images are accounted as app data instead of app cache. I'd like to delete the images by clearing the apps' cache, but thus I cannot. clearing the data would also delete the apps' login credentials, which I think is problematic.
So please mark the image cache as app cached data.

title: Update launcher icon with flat long-shadow variant
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
As discussed at #317, here's the PR to update the app launcher icon. Round icon support hasn't been added and neither has support for adaptive icons. I don't know how to do either and I think we'll need Michael Cook's help for the latter with regards to a foreground and background layer unless someone here can do it.

All the `.png`s were generated using the provided `.svg`.

Also, as mentioned at #595, the icons need go into the `mipmap` directory only if we are building different apks for different display density (which I think we aren't).

Also, the discussion at #595 mentioned the welcome icons but I don't think they need changing because they represent the service while these icons represent one specific product based off that service. Also, they look better in that context. That's just my understanding of it and I will make a PR for them as well if someone feels that is required.

Someone will need to credit Michael Cook for the icon in the About screen so that the requisite credits are present when this icon goes live. This is how he said he would like to be credited:  

> If you'd like to include credits, please do something like: Michael Cook, http://cookicons.co

Would be nice if this was also mentioned in the changelog for the version in which this goes live for that's how I discovered him in the first place and I'd like to pay that forward.

title: Voice read doesn't work without Internet connection
body:
I'm a recent user of your app, and so far I'm loving it. I think I especially love the voice sintesyzer: I can hear my saved articles while I'm working out at the park or doing the weekly shopping or any of those routinary tasks that don't require much concentration but don't allow us to be reading our mobile's screen for many minutes. Now I can do more than just listening music (which is great, of course, but sometimes I like to know from my favoriute columnists or heard that blog post I hadn't the time to read the other day). Is fantastic.

But the downside is that it requires an Internet connection, and consumes a nice amount of data: about 10 min. took almost 5 MB from my data plan (I normally use the voice sintezyser at 170% speed; don't know if higher speed makes more data to be up/downloaded per minute).
Well, AFAIK both the sintesyzer software and the voice files are installed in our android devices by default, so, why the Internet connection? Couldn't all the process be done locally, on the device, keeping our data plans intact and also keeping what we hear private?
There's also the privacy issue I've mentioned: If I'm sending to Google's servers the articles I'm hearing, Google is associating what I listen with my device ID, IP address, SIM card serial number, location, and all those permissions that Android doesn't report but if we use some app like Xprivacy we "discover". Well, if an Internet connection is indispensable because the process can't be done only on the device, could you switch Google's servers for some other that are fairly good in regards to service's quality, but it's also privacy friendly, and, if possible, FLOSS?

Regards.

title: Enhancement: convert text-selection to tags
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Tags are generally present as words in the relevant articles. Moreover, it's not always obvious from the title of a piece what all the tags for it may be (e.g., a list of tools or techniques).

It would be good to have a quick way to add tags from the text, without having to Copy/Manage tags/Paste/Add/Save.

The less intrusive I can think of would be to add an `Use as tag‘, or similar, context menu option on text selections.

title: Connection Test fails with Basic Auth with 2.0.1
body:
I am using Basic Auth to protect my wallabag 2.2.3 installation. This was and is working fine with the 1.12.2 app. However with 2.0.1 the connection test is failing.

I entered the proper connection settings and Autofill is working. The client registers, gets a secret (that matches with what the webclient shows). Still, after navigating to the main screen, the proposed connection test fails.

It says: **API access test failed**
Unknown error:
AuthorizationException: HTTP response: 401 Unauthorized

On the server, I see this log:

```
"GET / HTTP/1.1" 302 4616 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
"GET /login HTTP/1.1" 200 1546 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
"POST /login_check HTTP/1.1" 302 832 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
"GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 6837 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
"GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 6837 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
[auth_basic:error] [pid 4526] [client 189.4.72.29:9498] AH01614: client used wrong authentication scheme: /api/version.json
"GET /api/version.json HTTP/1.1" 401 4543 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
"POST /oauth/v2/token HTTP/1.1" 401 684 "-" "okhttp/3.8.1"
```

Looks like one  of those requests is made without basic auth. If that is the problem, it should be an easy fix.

title: Give an option to hide articles with label from default list
body:
One way to organize the articles is to assign them labels. This way they appear in the dedicated view, selecting the label. It would help a lot to have them disappear, at the same time, from the default view, in a "zero inbox" logic.
I imagine there could be a configuration option to change the default view to "label-free" view.

title: Set selected tag in UI when restoring main activity
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body: Fixes #625.

title: Clear tag input when added
label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
At the moment, adding tags through the app involves typing something, and seeing a selection of matching tags, in case the desired one is already there.

Selecting a tag in the filtered selection adds the tag to the article, but the tag input and filtered selection is not cleared. It needs to be manually emptied before typing another tag in.

It would be more practical, once a tag has been selected, to clear the tag input field and the list of matching tags.

title: Fix login page detection when html code is minified
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
Some web servers allow to minify code before send it to the client (like mod_pagespeed or or cady with minify plugin)
This merge request replace the login and csrf detection to allow use minify module in the webserver.

This merge request solve the issue #497

title: use physical button to disable touch display
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
following on #168, I'd like to be able to use a physical button from my inkbook prime (e-ink device running with android) to disable the touch display (and enable it back later on). This gives me more freedom to grasp the device while reading (because touching on the display doesn't change the content on the display).
The inkbook prime's key for disabling/enabling touch send the KeyEvent |KEYCODE_CAMERA| (according to https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/168#issuecomment-321997364). 

Thanks for considering.

title: Getting HTTP 403 after archiving article
body:
I'm logged in to my wallabag instance (I see Android App as a listed client on the web app).
It correctly performs the first update and if I add a new article from the website, the app then correctly fetches it.

If I archive an article from the app, I get a "UnsuccesfulResponseException: HTTP response: 403 forbidden" and the archived article of course is not synced back to the server.
Also I can't even fetch new articles anymore after this, I have to run the connection wizard again and re-sync everything.

My wallabag instance is on HTTP, not HTTPS, could that be an issue?
Even so, it should not allow my to login at all...

How can I fix this?

Edit:
app version: 2.0.1 (105)
backend: 2.2.3 (commit 82307d8)

title: Add image zoom
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Hi,

It would be great to be able to:

- tap an image, it would open in fullscreen mode
- be able to (un)zoom in that fullscreen mode

Thanks!

title: Can't connect my Wallabag instance
body:
Hello,
I'm self-hosting my Wallabag instance, my server runs the official Docker image, unmodified. I can use the iOS application and Wallabagger without any issue.

But, I can use this Android application. The connection assistant always returns Wallabag is not found at the specified address and I should check the URL...which is correct of course.

My Wallabag uses HTTPS with a Let's Encrypt certificate. I can create a test account of you need to diagnose.

title: New versions are signed with different key on F-Droid
body:
Whenever I try to update the app through F-Droid I get the message stating that the new version is signed with a different key, therefore I need to re-install the app. This happened from the last 1.x to 2.x and I thought maybe because it major was a version (strange I know), but now is also happening for a minor 2.0.0 -> 2.0.1.
Is there any special reason for this?

title: widget to get the number of unread article
body:
Hi,
Is it possible to have a widget that permits to display the wallagab picture with a red bubble in the right corner of it, that will tell us how many articles we still haven't read yet ?
Regards

title: Choose icon shortcuts in article view [Suggestion]
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
Hello,
First, thank you all for the great app on Android!

I wanted to suggest a new option, in wallabag's app parameters, allowing to choose what shortcuts you want to display when reading an article. 

By default, the "Mark as read" and "Mark as favorite" icons are shown (plus "Share" in landscape mode). However, I think that the shortcuts one might want here really depends on the usage you have of wallabag. For example, one might want to mark articles as read and tag the articles for further reference, when another one will delete every article after reading them.

Thus, I would really enjoy the possibility to have an option allowing me to choose which two shortcuts I want to see among the elements in the menu.

I am really hoping to see that in coming releases and I would be happy to develop the idea a bit more if necessary or if I am unclear.

Cheers

title: New options for link menu: Share and Copy link
label: [Label(name="Easy"), Label(name="Feature")]

The app currently allows to open in-article links either in the browser, or add them to the Wallabag instance.

It would be good if it were possible to simply copy the link URL from there, and maybe even share it to any other willing app.

title: Add Android O support
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
This adds the new [android maven repo](https://developer.android.com/preview/migration.html#uya) and sets the required version of Android from API 11 (Android 3.0) to API 14 (Android 4.0), because of a Google library. According to the Play Store stats, only 0.1% of users should be affected.

This shouldn't be released until Android O is out (in a few weeks I guess).

title: solarized theme: fix icon color in action bar of article list and article view
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
This fixes #337. But there is a dependency for API level 21. I get a
lint error for the changed lines now:

> Using theme references in XML drawables requires API level 21 (current min is 11) less... (Strg+F1)
> This check scans through all the Android API calls in the application and warns about any calls that are not available on all versions targeted by this application (according to its minimum SDK attribute in the manifest).  If you really want to use this API and don't need to support older devices just set the minSdkVersion in your build.gradle or AndroidManifest.xml files.  If your code is deliberately accessing newer APIs, and you have ensured (e.g. with conditional execution) that this code will only ever be called on a supported platform, then you can annotate your class or method with the @TargetApi annotation specifying the local minimum SDK to apply, such as @TargetApi(11), such that this check considers 11 rather than your manifest file's minimum SDK as the required API level.  If you are deliberately setting android: attributes in style definitions, make sure you place this in a values-vNN folder in order to avoid running into runtime conflicts on certain devices where manufacturers have added custom attributes whose ids conflict with the new ones on later platforms.  Similarly, you can use tools:targetApi="11" in an XML file to indicate that the element will only be inflated in an adequate context.

label: [Label(name="Feature")]

For example a filter for some "light reading on the road":

Some of the criteria that should be included in the filters:
 * Reading time.
 * Tags.
 * Domain?
 * Search string?
 * Favorite?

title: Translate Play Android description & Improvements
label: [Label(name="Translations")]
body:
@wallabag/translators We need your help to translate the google play description. 

Short description: "wallabag is a self hosted read-it-later app. wallabag is free and open source."
Full description: "wallabag is a self hosted read-it-later app. Unlike to other services, wallabag is free and open source. It's made for you to comfortably read and archive your articles.

You can download wallabag on wallabag.org and follow the instructions to install it on your own server, or you can directly sign up on wallabag.it

This android application allows you read and manage your articles and automatically syncs them to the wallabag server.

SAVE FOR LATER:
Next time you find an article you want to read later, save it into wallabag. It will be automatically synced on your phone, your tablet, your e-reader or your computer. Therefore, your can read it anytime anywhere, even offline.

You can save an article into wallabag from nearly everywhere, including your computer and your favorite RSS reader apps.

A GREAT READING EXPERIENCE:

wallabag allows you to read articles inside a simple and pleasant view, without any distraction. You can customize wallabag depending on your reading style. 

BONUS FEATURES:
* Automatic synchronization between the server and the apps
* Downloading pictures for offline reading
* Tags to manage your content
* Speech synthesis to listen to your articles 

This application has been originally created by Jonathan GAULUPEAU and released under the GPL licence.
wallabag is a creation from Nicolas Lœuillet released under the MIT licence."

title: Sharing to the app causes an error notification if the app is not configured
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
The shared URL is saved, the "Welcome page" is shown as expected, but also an error notification appears (`IllegalArgumentExpection` about "https://" not being a valid URL).

This happens because the app doesn't check whether it is configured before trying to sync. I think that "configurationIsOk" is not enough for that (we need to be able to distinguish between "not configured at all" and "was configured, but doesn't work anymore"). This also applies to some dialogs that appear on startup.

title: Handle 500 server errors.
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
_From @bitmagewb on May 27, 2017 22:26_

The new Android client is causing PHP errors on my server when it tries to sync:

Upgraded Android client to 2.x and successfully retrieved API keys.  
Client starts syncing, then either fails with "Unknown error" or UnsuccessfulResponseException: HTTP Response: 500 Internal Server Error.  No articles are listed.

prod.log on server shows:
2017-05-27 18:05:29] request.INFO: Matched route "api_get_entries". {"route":"api_get_entries","route_parameters":{"_controller":"Wallabag\\ApiBundle\\Controller\\EntryRestController::getEntriesAction","_format":"json","_route":"api_get_entries"},"request_uri":"https://myserver/api/entries.json?order=asc&page=11&perPage=30&since=0&sort=created","method":"GET"} []
[2017-05-27 18:05:29] request.CRITICAL: Uncaught PHP Exception RuntimeException: "Your data could not be encoded because it contains invalid UTF8 characters." at /var/www/wallabag/vendor/jms/serializer/src/JMS/Serializer/JsonSerializationVisitor.php line 240 {"exception":"[object] (RuntimeException(code: 0): Your data could not be encoded because it contains invalid UTF8 characters. at /var/www/wallabag/vendor/jms/serializer/src/JMS/Serializer/JsonSerializationVisitor.php:240)"} []

The 1.x Android client and the web client continue to work without errors.

### Environment

* wallabag version (or git revision) that exhibits the issue: 2.2.3
* How did you install wallabag? Via `git clone` or by downloading the package? git clone
* Last wallabag version that did not exhibit the issue (if applicable): 
* php version: PHP 5.5.38
* OS: CentOS release 6.9
* type of hosting (shared or dedicated): dedicated 
* which storage system you choose at install (SQLite, MySQL/MariaDB or PostgreSQL): SQLite

### Steps to reproduce/test case
Upgrade android client to 2.x version and connect.



_Copied from original issue: wallabag/wallabag#3154_

title: Regarding the reasons why "Accept all SSL certificates" option was removed
body:
This option was intentionally removed because it creates **a false sense of security**. At any given moment you're not able to tell if your connection is actually secure or it was tampered with.

Possible solutions:
 * If you don't want to deal with certification authorities, you can import your self-signed certificate into your Android system.
 * You can get a free SSL/TLS certificate (e. g. [Let's Encrypt](https://letsencrypt.org)) to take advantage of modern TLS security.
  If you don't have a domain name yet, you might need to register it. Nowadays you can register a cheap (or maybe even free) domain name.
 * If you have an SSL/TLS certificate, but you get `java.security.cert.CertPathValidatorException: Trust anchor for certification path not found` **and** you used the option to avoid the error, then **you should configure your server properly**. See #516.

Also, feel free to create a PR for #258 to implement a memorizing trust manager.

Thanks for your time.

title: ship alphas to f-droid / app store
body:
Hi,

I see the Android client is making huge progress. My particular pet peeve is the lack of tag support in the 1.x versions, which seems to have improved in the first alpha already... Is there a way to get a version distributed on f-droid and/or the app store? In f-droid at least, there is a way to mark a version as "beta" so that people don't upgrade by default.

Now, i know I could install the packages straight from the release pages on GitHub, but the signature seemed different the last time I checked. This may be because F-Droid rebuilds the APKs and resigns them with its own signatures... I am not sure how to fixed this, so I asked the F-Droid people to clarify that part:

https://forum.f-droid.org/t/are-reproducible-builds-possible-now/335

Still - I can't wait to get tag support and it would be great to be able to test that easily.

Thanks!

title: Better login page detection ("Wallabag service not found" if the page minified)
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Currently the app relies on basic string comparison to detect which page it receives. If the HTML code is modified, the app fails to recognize the page. [Here's an example of a minified login page](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/495#issuecomment-291929905).

This also applies to the API clients page parsing.

title: Wallabag service not found - check URL
body:
Hello,

The app was working perfectly fine a few days ago, then I noticed that it stopped wanting to sync. The sync error notification was kind of cryptic and didn't provide much information (sorry I can't remember what it said, and can't reproduce at this point). I then decided to clear the app cache, delete local database, etc and start fresh. Now the error I get when doing a test connection is `Wallabag service not found - check URL`.

Info:

* Wallbag android app version - 1.12.2 (32)
* Wallbag server version - 2.2.2
  * Self hosted server
* Using SSL/HTTPS
* Not using 2FA
* The previous RSS token that was stored in the app worked fine when tested outside the app
  * I regenerated just because, and the new token works as expected
* I am entering correct user/password
* I am entering `https://subdomain.domain.com` as the service url
* My server does url rewriting to `/app.php{uri}`

This is the access log of the server when the app tries to make a connection:
```
1.1.1.1 - [05/Apr/2017:13:48:25 +0000] "GET /app.php/ HTTP/1.1" 302 260
1.1.1.1 - [05/Apr/2017:13:48:25 +0000] "GET /app.php/login HTTP/1.1" 200 4119
1.1.1.1 - [05/Apr/2017:13:48:25 +0000] "GET /app.php/ HTTP/1.1" 302 260
1.1.1.1 - [05/Apr/2017:13:48:25 +0000] "GET /app.php/login HTTP/1.1" 200 4119
1.1.1.1 - [05/Apr/2017:13:48:25 +0000] "GET /app.php/login/ HTTP/1.1" 404 325
```

Not sure what I messed up here and I didn't have luck finding any existing issues that matched what I am experiencing exactly. Happy to help debug further, just not sure what to try next.

title: Show time to read (estimated reading time) on article list
label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
When choosing what to read next, the time it will take to read the piece is an important factor. At the moment, the app only displays this on the article's page only, which requires one to open an article, check the duration, then decide whether to read it or to go back to the list to look for a more suitable article.

It would be good to show this time to read on the main list, maybe to the right of the line showing the site that each item comes from. This would make scanning the list for a article of the desired length much faster.

Also, I have to handle the right position for this information.
Any help appreciated.

title: TTS is reading image tags
body: wallabag app master branch When I use Text-to-Speech it's really annoying that it read `` in each image of the article. Is there a way to exclude that tags from reading?

title: Improve Search responsiveness
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
There are two obvious options:
 * Use "submit" button for Search field instead of performing search on every text change.
 * If the text in the search field changes, don't immediately update list, but schedule an update with a short delay. If the text is changed again (shortly after that), reschedule the update.

The options can be combined.

Current implementation contains hacks that ~~preserve the search field state~~ open new search field with the same text when context menu is recreated, so it should be done carefully.

title: Search button in Android app
body:
_From @Suncatcher on March 19, 2017 11:40_

After some using of the app I wanna propose such UI improvement: to implement Search button in the upper-left corner.
Now one should make 3 actions to call a search:
1. Press menu button
2. Tap Search menu item
3. Enter text pattern

What I propose is a Search button in the upper left. When tapped it turns out into search box, which receive text input.
The example can be found in the mail app Mailbird, for example. This is how its search button looks like in idle mode

![sketch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6388034/24080466/758ae766-0ca8-11e7-824a-32126218f27e.png)

And this is when it is input-ready
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6388034/24080471/8ac07646-0ca8-11e7-8d35-1e149120a1b7.png)

It seems, that none of you, guys, ever used wallabag for big amounts of data, and everybody have only 5 articles or so-so :) The lack of batch tools seems quite evident for me.

_Copied from original issue: wallabag/wallabag#2995_

title: Has Framabag support been permanently dropped?
body:
I know that Wallabag isn't responsible for Framabag not updating to the latest version but is there anything that Wallabag can do to get Framabag to update?

I am unable to see any options to contact the Framabag team on their website and I was wondering if members of the Wallabag team could contact them and request them to update. It remains the easiest method to start using Wallabag. 

I know that this doesn't qualify as an issue in the usual sense but I wanted to discuss it with y'all and this felt like the best way to do that.

label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
wallabag-app master branch (and older versions too)

Article list scroll is fine, I like it but there is something annoying.
1) I scroll down and the list automatically increases and shows more articles.
2) I click one article, I read it and I click archive
3) Now I am at the top of the article list again and I have to scroll down

I think the article list position should be remembered when you load more articles.

title: Re-download images
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
**wallabag-app master branch**

I have the option "Cache images locally" checked in the app (not in wallabag web). Sometimes there is a problem downloading the images and I can't see it in some articles. Related https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/444#issuecomment-283505478
If I delete the article and add it again usually works, so there is no problem with the article.

I propose to implement 3 solutions:
1) When you update the article list try to re-download missing images (I mean partial, I don't know if full update tries to redownload all images but I think this is to much overhead)
2) If you enter in one article and images are not stored locally, try to show the online version, and then save them locally.
3) Add a button to refetch the article (download both, text and images).

![screenshot_2017-03-05-15-41-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10577978/23588264/2e0ad1d2-01bb-11e7-8327-1cfee07469a8.png)

title: Fix storage access for image caching
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
It seems I've broken storage access in #433 for Android API levels ∈ [19; 22]. 
#433 was correct according to docs, but there seems to be [a bug](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=81357).

As a result, the app on these devices may silently ignore "cache images" option.

title: keep the search set when an article is marked as read
label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="Legacy"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
do a search
select an article, don't read it, go back and the search set is still available
but if you mark the article as read the search set will be lost

title: Option to keep screen on while reading
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Currently, the app offers no option to keep the screen on (overriding the display timeout), which is a very handy feature to have in a reading app.

There is an open source app that does this really well and might be of use in implementing it here: [FBReader](https://github.com/geometer/FBReaderJ).

body: I didn't include Hungarian translation because it is at 61.2% of completion.

title: Connection works via web browser but fails in Windows 10 app
body: I just created an account at Framabag.org and, using the address https://www.framabag.org/u/profbib along with my username (which I have verified in the activation email to be typed correctly) & password and everything (viewing articles, saving them) works fine in the web browser, but initial connection fails in the Windows 10 app.  When trying to log in there, I used the same information above after selecting "other" at the initial screen, but get a connection error each and every time.  Any ideas?  I looked through a couple of the other issues involving connection errors, but it seems like most have been solved and several involved personal instances of Wallabag rather than the Framabag instance. Thanks in advance.

title: ImageCache: ignore images with relative/incorrect URLs
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body: Fixes crash in image fetching.

title: User-accessible logs
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
We often need to request logs from users. Sometimes it is a real PITA.

We need a way to easily gather and copy logs from within the app.

Standard `android.util.Log` doesn't provide any way to redirect or collect logs. It is possible to call `logcat` and gather the results, but it is ugly and has some limitations.

I was thinking about moving to [SLF4J](https://www.slf4j.org/) + [logback-android](https://tony19.github.io/logback-android/). It should allow to log to various outputs (standard Android logcat, file, etc.). Also, SLF4J's API is better (no need for explicit `String.format()` in logging). Though, it would require to replace all the `android.util.Log` usages.
I don't see any downsides of it.

Any other ideas?

title: wallabag app crashes when "Cache in article embedded images" enabled
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
I'm using the latest version of the Android app with wallabag.it.

This morning, I saw the update and I went in my settings to enable "Cache in article embedded images". Immediately after that the application crashes with "wallabag has stopped". 

Now the application crashes when I try to synchronise with the "reload" button in the menu and sometimes crashes when I open it.

If I disable the "Cache in article embedded images" settings, everything is working fine again.

title: Update lists
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
Adds "endless scrolling" instead of limited list. Memory may still be an issue.

Use `DiffUtil` to update lists partially.

I'm not completely sure about the implementation, so suggestions are welcome.

~~Also, I think I had an issue with the lists not being updated after actions like "open an article - add it to favorite - go back to lists". I couldn't reproduce it yet. I added logging of warning messages "fragment is null". I'm pretty sure it should either update list or log the warning. I have no idea why the fragments can be null after they were initialized (initially I thought, that it might be related to threading, but only the main thread is supposed to access fragments).~~ Probably fixed with 2630998.

Related issues:
* Basic search: partly #113.
* Sync queue before full update: #127.
* Sorting order: partly #17 and #42.

Testing needed.

title: Don't stuck on deleted articles
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:

v1.9 endpoint seems to be unaffected by the issue.

Fixes #319 #375.

title: Don't retry to delete article if 404 received -> high battery drain
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
I am seeing an odd behaviour due (probably) to deleting an article both in the Android app, and the Web interface before it synced.

Now, the Android app repeatedly tries to delete the article, as seen in my webserver logs:

    wallabag.example.net 192.0.2.1 - - [19/Dec/2016:06:25:56 +0100] "GET /delete/3992 HTTP/1.1" 200 818 "-" "okhttp/3.4.1"
    wallabag.example.net 192.0.2.1 - - [19/Dec/2016:06:26:01 +0100] "GET /delete/3992 HTTP/1.1" 200 818 "-" "okhttp/3.4.1"
    wallabag.example.net 192.0.2.1 - - [19/Dec/2016:06:26:07 +0100] "GET /delete/3992 HTTP/1.1" 200 818 "-" "okhttp/3.4.1"

Oddly enough, the application sees this as 404 error, as per the logcat (to follow), and keeps popping an unknown error (also to follow) before retrying to sync immediately. This leads to a high battery drain.

There are several things that could be done to address the issue.
* HTTP DELETE should be idempotent, and not return a 404, or any indication that the object to delete was not there, to the client. This is a GET happening here, but it should probably follow the same semantics
* In the current situation, if the Android app receives a 200 from a `GET /delete/...` wrapping a 404, this means that Wallabag has responded properly, but the item is no longer there, there should therefore be no need to retry the delete.
* Add some sort of incremental back-off in case of repeated sync failures to avoid draining the battery.
* Add a way to clear the app's sync queue, so one can manually cancel local sync actions that might be causing this sort of issue.

title: Don't retry to delete article if 404 receive
Not escaped </script> tag in feed

title: v2 API
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
I started to work on [v2 API wrapper library](https://github.com/di72nn/wallabag-api-wrapper) a couple of days ago. The library's API is far from being finished.

Here's a proof of concept. The android app that performs "Favorite/Unfavorite" via API (I've done basic implementation for the most of the v2 API methods in the library, but not yet integrated it in the app).

Changes:
 - Moved to v2 API. Dropped v1.9 support.
 - Rewritten update mechanism: faster (supposedly), more consistent (no updates for separate feeds that screw things up) updates.
 - Update on startup (#360).
 - Basic tags support (list by tag, add/modify/delete tags on articles) (#116).
 - Changed main activity UI (in order to have better navigation between tags and other lists).
 - Notifications updated a bit (progress added, etc.).
 - Other minor changes.

New opportunities (**not yet implemented** features that are now possible):
 - Show tags in lists and in article view.
 - Change article title (only UI is not implemented) (#288).
 - New data is available in DB: estimated reading time, language, preview picture URL, article creation date.

Issues:
 - Nav bar is not well themed (selected item color, title with logo color/background).

body:
In a feat of procrastination I wrote some code for the app to invoke QR-code scanner.
I added a button on one of the wizard pages. Suggestions are welcome.

body:
A follow-up to #365.

Also replace "app.wallabag.it" with "wallabag.it" in display-only strings. Users don't care about the "app." part, do they?

cc @nicosomb

In the last commit I fixed some minor stuff.

title: Add a button to start QR-code scanner to set up the app
label: [Label(name="Easy"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body: So the user doesn't have to find and launch QR-code scanner manually.

title: Selective offline storage

body: Allow to select specific categories/tags to store for offline reading (don't store other articles).

title: Automatic update when the app is opened.

title: Two-factor authentication (2FA) support
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
The app does not support 2FA (not relevant for wallabag v1.9).

Also maybe add a notice somewhere about 2FA not being supported in the meantime.

title: Show estimated reading time
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
It should be great to have information of estimate reading time for each article.

Estimate reading time is particularly interesting on Smartphone as articles can be read in a bus, in the metro or in a plane, where travel time is very different.

This information is displayed in web interface of Wallabag (actually Wallabag v1 which is my instance, i don't know for wallabag v2) but i have not been able to find it in Android app.

title: Article list does not get refreshed after full update
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
When i start the app, and do a full refresh via that button, sometimes my article list does not get refreshed although there were new items. How do i know that? It behaves strange. I open after the update, e.g. the first article, but the opened article is a completely different than i clicked on. It is one of the new articles being freshly synced. If i go back to the list again, it is still the old list and i can repeat the behaviour.

This bug is not always reproducible and i do not know the conditions how to reproduce that. But i already had that bug several times.

I did not have that behaviour when my logcat console was nearby. But if that happens one day, i am going to provide a log for this issue. But maybe we find the issue without it.

title: Some fixes
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
Fixes #352.
The `onCreateOptionsMenu()` method was called before the article was loaded.

Fixes #353.
Supposedly, a background update operation made local `mArticle` object outdated. so we query for a new one before updating it.
I'm not proud of 3d439b1 quality, but the class ought to be rewritten anyway.

title: Use a service like transifex for translations
label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="Translations")]
body:
It's not like it is our main problem, but usage of such services significantly facilitates project translation (from translators' point of view).

*Personally, I don't endorse SaaS, but in this case I find the compromise acceptable (a translation service can't tie us to itself - we can always switch to a different one or reject it).*

I checked out a few open source apps, here's the list by service:

**Transifex**:
Amaze File Manager
Autostarts
Clementine
Clementine Remote
Conversations
DAVdroid
K-9 Mail
OpenKeychain
OSMTracker
ownCloud
? VLC


**Crowdin**:
DiasporaForAndroid
OpenVPN for Android
Xabber


**POEditor**:
Loop Habit Tracker


**Weblate**:
F-Droid
Red Moon


I had no projects translated with such a service, so I have no opinion from a maintainer's point of view.
I have little experience as a translator on such platforms. For some reason I didn't like POEditor. Transifex and Crowdin seem fine, **but (if I'm not mistaken) Transifex requires a translator to join a project (requires maintainer's confirmation) before he can do anything (like see a list of lines or suggest a translation)**. Maybe it is configurable, but it works like that [even here](https://www.transifex.com/wallabag/wallabag/).
Crowdin allows anyone with an account to suggest translations. Crowdin is my personal preference so far.

body:
I just shared an URL from my Firefox to the wallabag app and i did not receive any feedback. So i tried again and again, but it still did not give feedback nor could i see my added article in the list of items. Not even after full sync! 

I attached the mobile to my PC and i saw the following log:

```
10-30 10:50:24.888 11950-11950/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/BagItProxyActivity: Bagging https://www.elie.net/blog/security/fuller-house-exposing-high-end-poker-cheating-devices

10-30 10:50:24.901 11950-11950/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/ServiceHelper: archiveArticle() finished
10-30 10:50:24.921 11950-11950/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/BGService: BGService() created
10-30 10:50:24.923 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/BGService: onHandleIntent() started
10-30 10:50:24.927 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/BGService: serveSimpleRequest() started; action: AddLink, articleID: null, link: https://www.elie.net/blog/security/fuller-house-exposing-high-end-poker-cheating-devices
10-30 10:50:24.927 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/DbConnection: using existing db session
10-30 10:50:24.931 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/QueueHelper: addLink("https://www.elie.net/blog/security/fuller-house-exposing-high-end-poker-cheating-devices") started
10-30 10:50:24.931 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/greenDAO: Built SQL for query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "QUEUE_ITEM" T  WHERE T."ACTION"=? AND T."EXTRA"=?
10-30 10:50:24.931 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/greenDAO: Values for query: [1, https://www.elie.net/blog/security/fuller-house-exposing-high-end-poker-cheating-devices]
10-30 10:50:24.933 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/QueueHelper: addLink() the link is already in queue
10-30 10:50:24.933 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/QueueHelper: addLink() finished

10-30 10:50:24.933 11950-13790/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche.debug D/BGService: onHandleIntent() finished
```

Four issues i have here:
# 1Can we please give the user feedback when adding multiple times

I expected adding the link did not work, but it did. It was just added to the offline queue. Say this to me in a toast, please, like: "your url is already added to the offline queue"
# 2 Why is the url added to the offline queue?

I am online and it is still added to the offline queue. Why? From a programmers point of view i understand, but can we immediately please sync local queue items to the wallabag instance if we detect i am online?
# 3 I did not receive feedback on first adding of the url

So even when i added the article at first, i also got no feedback. A toast is needed here, too: "your url has been added to wallabag"
# 4 Open app and auto-sync

Please auto-sync offline queue when i start the app and i am online.

Should i create separate issues for my four items here?

title: Actions for articles removed on server are stuck in offline queue
label: [Label(name="Bug"), Label(name="Question")]
body:
1. Remove an article on server.
2. Try to remove / favorite / mark as read it in the app.

Expected result: no errors, article is changed offline until "full sync" is done (probably).

Actual result:
"Unknown error" is shown. The offline queue sync is blocked (no future changes will be synced until the erroneous action is somehow removed).

Cause: server (v2) responds with HTTP status code `404` for any action with removed articles. (I did not test it against v1 server).

This is pretty serious, because there are no way for user to get rid of it except to clear the app data (at least I'm not aware of any other way).

title: Fix UI freezes
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
I rewrote something I wanted to rewrite almost from the beginning of #282.

Action processing before this PR (does not apply to "sync queue" and "update feeds" actions):
1. _(DB transaction is started here)._
2. The offline queue is checked.
3. If the action wasn't canceled out by queue contents, an attempt to transmit the action to server is performed.
4. If the transmission fails, the action is added to the offline queue.
5. _(DB transaction is ended here)._
6. ...
7. The queue is synced sometime later.

After this PR:
1. _(This is done inside of one short DB transaction)_ The offline queue is checked. If the action is not canceled out, it is added to the queue.
2. If the queue is not empty, "sync offline queue" action is triggered.
3. The queue is synced _(using only one short DB transaction to write changes at the end)_.

Essentially, the queue sync is the only way to pass local changes to the server. That change allowed to remove a lot of code duplication. And it also allowed to remove most of the DB transactions that presumably caused UI freezes. 
Though, the is a limitation: the is no (easy?) way to get the action result for a specific action. But it was barely used anyway.

Fixes #315.

title: Use JobScheduler on Android 5+
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
_I initially committed it to `fix-lint-issues` branch, but I think this change should be merged ASAP._

I fixed a `BatteryLife` warning: on Lollipop+ it will use [`JobScheduler`](https://developer.android.com/topic/performance/background-optimization.html) to schedule a job (to run it when network becomes available), on older Android versions it will use the usual BroadcastReceiver. I **did not** test it on Android 5+. It affects only "Separate auto-sync for local changes" option.
Essentially, without `JobScheduler` the `CONNECTIVITY_CHANGE` event probably won't be delivered on Android 5+.

title: Better "Temporary errors" detection
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
We have a class of errors named "Temporary" (these errors are not shown to the user), which should include errors like connection break, random connection timeout and such (all exceptions are probably subclasses of `IOException`). I marked `IOException` (and the subclasses) as "Unknown" error type, so it will be shown in a notification. **We need to gather a list of various errors that are shown as "Unknown" but should be considered as "Temporary".**

**The exception info (a Java class name and a message) should be visible in an expanded error notification.**

An example: `java.net.UnknownHostException` since it may be thrown if the connection was established recently and the DNS is not available yet (this is considered temporary if the hostname was successfully resolved in the past - the `configurationIsOk` flag is set).

List of temporary exceptions:
- `java.net.UnknownHostException` if `configurationIsOk`.
- `java.net.ConnectException` if `configurationIsOk`.
- `java.net.SocketTimeoutException` if `configurationIsOk`.
- `javax.net.ssl.SSLException` if `configurationIsOk` and an error message contains "Connection timed out".

title: Minor improvements
body:
Follow-up changes for #282. Mostly minor changes.
- Improved migration flow: app launch; suggestion to test connection; if connection is fine, automatically start to update feeds.
- Hide "Sync local changes" from menu if no unsynced changes.
- Add an option to clear cookies.
- Apply some connection parameters changes without restart (as for now: "Accept all SSL certs" and "Custom SSL settings").

title: Decent offline functionality and other improvements
body:
Ok, I finally started to implement it.

The first batch of changes:
- Update and add some dependencies: update greendao, okhttp, add greenrobot:eventbus.
- Update DB schema (add QueueItem), regenerate greendao classes.
- Add an IntentService and some basic logic to perform network-related operations in BG service and to enqueue failed actions for later sync.

I create this PR so we can discuss something about it in the future.
Currently I have some thing to implement, so code-related collaboration is not yet needed (not that I expect much).

TODO:
- [x] Use background service for the most operations.
- [x] Handle offline operations.
- [x] Basic auto-sync.
- [x] Decent notifications.
- [x] Basic PreferenceFragment-based settings.
- [x] Set `configurationIsOk` flag somewhere (requires configuration master/wizard?).
- [x] Unset `configurationIsOk` flag in Settings.
- [x] Delete obsolete translation lines.

Not so urgent/important TODO:
- [Better temporary errors detection](#issuecomment-230098478).
- Better/prettier/fancier notifications.
- Do something with UI responsiveness (while background operation is performed).
- Refactoring: reuse code.

Separate features/improvements:
- Show last update time somewhere.
- Differentiate Wi-Fi and data connection in auto-update?
- Download PDF in BGService.
- Use support library for Settings?

title: Issue when adding any page on the app after the app has timed out once
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
Context : I have a framabag instance. Wallabag is installed on my android phone and my android tablet.
I use it on my tablet at home without issue (steady wifi and FFTH at home).
However, in the bus on my way to work, the connection is very bad and there are a lot of timeouts (different from a 'no service' like in the metro, which causes no bug).
If I access wallabag during one of those timeouts, it will cause issue to happen. And later, I can't save an article using my phone, because "ID or password are incorrect". Which it is not of course, because I did not change them.
Proofs that they are not incorrect:
- I can still access wallabag from my tablet and computer with the same old ID/password
- I can still access wallabag on my phone and it updates correctly. Ex: I add an article using my computer, refresh my wallabag on the phone -> it works! so it manages to read the data on the server.
- If I delete the wallabag app from my phone, reinstall it, use the same ID/password and token... I can add articles using my phone. Until the next timeout (and then it's the same all over again).

If you need any logs or more information, just tell me how to get it and I will provide it.

title: Support redirection in given wallabag URLs
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
When we enter a URL in the settings, which redirects to another URL, we cannot login and get the user credentials for the feed. 
E.g. in issue #276 there is a redirection described, which just redirects from http to https. The app shall support this.

title: [Android 6] "Erreur de connexion" à la synchro
body:
_English translation below._

J'ai fait la MAJ vers Android 6 hier et depuis, je rencontre le problème suivant.
Sur l'appli, j'ouvre un article, je le tick pour archivage, et lors du retour sur l'index des "Non lus", la pop-up suivante apparaît :
"
Erreur de connexion
Impossible de se connecter :
L'identifiant et le mot de passe doivent être erronés
"
Si je vais dans les params de l'appli et que je fais "Tester la connexion", j'ai la pop-up suivante qui apparaît: 
"
Échec
Impossible de se connecter. Vérifiez votre identifiant et votre mot de passe.
Corde d'erreur: 2
"
Pas de problème de connexion sur l'appli Web, je n'ai donc pas changé mes IDs à mon insu :)

Besoin d'infos complémentaires ?

_**English translation (tcit)**_

I made the update to Android 6 yesterday and since then, I encounter the following issue : 
On the app, I open an article, I mark it for archive, and when returning on "Unread" index, the following popup shows :

> Connection error
> Could not login
> ID and password must be wrong

If I go the the app settings and I test connection, I have the following popup showing : 

> Failure
> Unable to connect. Check ID and password.
> Error code: 2

No issue trying to connect to the web app, so I didn't change my ids not knowing. :)

Need extra informations ?

Use Google's metrics and make it the color it would be were a 20% opacity #000000 overlay be placed above Base2

title: Strubbl feature 216 export articles as pdf
Self signed certificate storage / Memorizing trust manager
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
On android 4+, it is very annoying that you have to store the self signed certificates in the android trusted credential key storage, because this prevents the usage of the fingerprint scanner (due to security policy of android).
It would be great to implement a way to store self signed certificated in wallabag like it happens for all the other apps that accept self signed certificates.

title: building as debug results in different app (id)
body:
This commit introduces a different package name for the debug build of
this application. It is useful when having installed Wallabag app from
an app store and besides developing the app. You can now have a debug
and release version installed on your device in parallel.
The debug version of this app has a different app id, a different version name and a different
launcher icon (same as release, but with a small green bug).

Thanks to Wonderfall for reporting.

title: Add as an 'Open With' Target
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Currently, my workflow for Wallabag is as follows:
- Open link in email/app/etc
- Navigate to said link in web browser
- Share link from web browser to wallabag

This is a request/ideation to have Wallabag register itself as a Web browser (or at least a handler of HTTP links) so that the loop from app -> browser -> wallabag can be shortened (i.e. middle man being removed).

J'utilise Android 6 sur nexus 5

title: Add "Custom SSL settings" option
body:
Fixes #183.
The method is used in DAVdroid, so it's probably fine.
The option is not very useful if you run Android 5+ **and** your server prefers TLS (I'm not an expert in that area, maybe MitM-attacks still can force your connection to fallback to SSL - in that case the option is useful on any recent Android version).

title: Offline URLs upload: skip failed URLs
body: ...instead of stopping on first fail.

title: Refactoring
body:
Mostly minor refactoring. The only more or less significant change is lazy initialization of `serviceEndpoint` in `WallabagService` -- the constructor is sometimes called in UI thread, that should not wait for `guessWallabagVersion()` to finish.

BTW, we have to do something with wallabag version guessing: right now the app makes at least two additional calls to server before **every** request (mark read, favorite, etc.). We shouldn't do that on mobile phones (well, _especially_ on mobile phones).
The most viable solution is to detect server version on saving settings, but it's not very convenient.
It is also possible to add "Wallabag server version" switch to the settings screen, which would be automatically set via 'Get credentials' button.

title: Pressing sync button should start a new sync
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body: When the connection is unstable, if I start a sync, it may get stalled and never end in timeout, even if I get a better connection aftewards. Worse, if I press the sync button later, it complains a sync is already running, though it'll never end. The only solution then is restarting the app.

title: offline mode
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Proposal of the day ;)  offline mode
- What's happen when internet connection is lost

we cant do anything as any action need to be synchronized once we have deleted or marked as read , etc.
- What could be done to fix it for a better ux

So it would be helpful if wallabag stores the history of actions we made locally, and then, plays the history, once the internet comes back to.
- a bit further

For each tag, a parameter could permit to use offline mode To avoid to consume too many space on our mobile / too many data in our mobile carrier subscription
For post without tag, a default behavior should be adopted.

title: Implements #216 Export articles as pdf
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]

This resolves #216 and adds the feature that you can download an article
to your device. When the download starts a Toast message is displayed
for the destination path and a thread handles the download in the background.

title: title with html escaping characters
body: In the list if articles, we see `&` instead of & in the title of articles, same for ' which gives `'`

title: Being able to make several changes at once / bulk actions

body:
From the list of articles, it will be very usefull to have  options that will permit to :
- delete several articles in the same time
- set a tag to several articles in the same time

title: Fixes #224 NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method
body:
'java.lang.Boolean fr.gaulupeau.apps.Poche.entity.Article.getFavorite()'
on a null object

To avoid the NullPointerException, we skip one loop cycle if we get null
instead of an article with a special id from the ArticleDao.

title: Fixes #221 Deleting an articles throws a 404 error
body:
This commit fixes #221 and some more issue w.r.t. toggle actions on an
article. In wallabag v2 if we request a toggle action, e.g. /star/123,
and if we are not logged in anymore, we get redirected to that action
after successful login. But our app then did re-toggle that action.
Therefore the action had been called twice. When deleting an article
this resulted in a 404. When starring or archiving, this toggled the
action twice --> resulting in no action.

So now if we recognize that we executing an action results in a login
page, we request a new login page, do a clean login and afterwards
recall the action request. This way we avoid getting redirected to the
action request.
