title: Fixes #218 Titles show encoding problems
body:
This commit fixes #218, where a title of an article was html encoded.
Now the title is html decoded before storing it as article with the help
of the method Html.fromHtml()

E.g. before:
`Using Let's Encrypt with Kerio Connect`
Now is saved:
`Using Let's Encrypt with Kerio Connect`

title: trailing slash handling in Wallabag instance URL
body:
According to the comments in https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/203#issuecomment-212333264 several users had the problem that if they entered a wallabag URL with a trailing slash, the app did not work. 

Do we want to handle the trailing slashes in the URL somehow?

If yes: how? only remove it and then save the URL to the settings? Does removing the trailing slash maybe cause any side effects?

title: Deleting an articles throws a 404 error
body: Recent Android app is not able to delete an article without error.

title: Set a limit of 500 articles to fetch, but only 50 are downloaded
label: [Label(name="Legacy")]
body: I configured a limit of 500 articles to fetch from my Wallabag 2.0.2 installation. But the limit is not respected. Currently I have about 220 articles and only 50 are fetched.

title: TTS: fix vector drawable crash on android 5.0
body: Was due to scientific notation numbers.

title: Titles show encoding problems
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
Message titles are not encoded correctly

Example:
Wallabag web shows: `Using Let's Encrypt with Kerio Connect`
Android App shows: `Using Let's Encrypt with Kerio Connect`

title: Write documentation about v2 app
label: [Label(name="Awaiting response"), Label(name="Documentation")]
body: Please add a new page here: https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/tree/master/docs to explain how to configure the application.

title: Export articles as pdf embedded in the app
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Work in progress")]
body: I think it would be a great feature to add a button to download the articles as a pdf (or mobi, or whatever format). The button already exists in the web interface, maybe it wouldn't be too hard to implement in the app.

title: Fixes getCredentials() if Wbg installed in subdir
body:
This commit fixes the problem with requesting the FeedsCredentials when
Wallabag v2 is installed in a subdirectory of the server e.g.
endpoint=http://server/wbg/. This is done with a check of the userID for
a slash. In the given example the userID would have been "wbg/user". Now, if a slash is found, only the string right of the slash ("user") is used as userID.

Hopefully a user name never contains a slash ;)

title: guessWallabagVersion() makes use of /api for v2
body:
Refactores guessWallabagVersion() into several methods having just one
task. The isWallabagVersion2() makes use of the provided API which was
introduced since v2.
Needed to increase minSdkVersion for isEmpty() check on Strings. (When some day the Widget PR will be merged, the minSdkVersion is increased anyway.)

title: App widget unread article count
label: [Label(name="Ready for review")]
body:
I created a widget which shows how many articles are saved in the Wallabag database of your Android app, which are unread. So if you are limiting the RSS feed in your Wallabag v2 (rss feed limit < no. unread articles), you will only see that limit and not the real unread count you see in the web browser.

![screenshot.png](https://i.imgur.com/uHDUAMu.png)

features of the widget:
- on click start the application
- trigger widget counter update on sync, archive or delete action in Wallabag app

_Thanks to K-9 Mail for inspiration._

title: fix the v2 check for valid Wallabag instance
body:
This PR fixes a problem reported in https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/203#issuecomment-210520327

The problem occurs when Wallabag v2 is not installed to / path of the
webserver, but in a subdirectory, e.g. wallabag/. Our regex check for
a validwallabag instance does not work anymore. Therefore the regex has
been shortened in the beginning.

title: implement getGenerateTokenRequest for Wallabag v2
body: Forgot to adjust that method for Wbg. v2. Unfortunately, i cannot really test that implementation. I only have one productive Wallabag v2 instance running at the moment, where i already have generated a token. It should work, but it would be nice if someone can test it before merging.

title: V2 support
body:
This PR is for the support of wallabag v2. Basic functionality works and is usable in daily life.

Fetching articles is limited to your setting in wallabag (article limit for RSS). I am closing former PRs #204 #207 and #208 because they are included here.

v2 functions for addLink, toggleArchive, toggleFavorite and deleteArticle are working. They give a 500 error at the moment, but this is reported in wallabag/wallabag#1924

title: TTS (Text to Speech) Support (Issue #5)
body:
Patch proposition to add a support for Text To Speech
https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/5

title: V2 feed update task
body:
UpdateFeedTask for v2 working. So limited amount of articles are loaded (depending on your config setting in wallabag)

dependenyc to PR #204 and PR #207

title: V2 (and V1) credentials
body: This PR has a dependency to PR #204 . It enables fetching the feed user id and the according token.

title: update gradle to 2.1.0-alpha5 for instant run
body:
This patch updates gradle to version 2.1.0-alpha5 to make use of the
newly introduced instant run feature in Android Studio 2.0. See also
https://sites.google.com/a/android.com/tools/tech-docs/instant-run

title: V2 (and V1) login
body:
These commits create the possibility to login against a Wallabag V2 _and_ V1 version. 

That means, if you go into your settings and either enter a v1 or v2 valid wallabag URL and hit the "Test connection" button, it will work.

title: app V1.9.x incompatibility with Wallabag V2.0.x
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
I'm actual not shure if it is known that the current android app seems to be incompatible with the recently released V2.0 server-version?

Seems like a bug to me

Kind regards

title: Text justification as an option
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="UI")]
body: I don’t feel comfortable reading an article with justified text, because the typographic balance is quite bad on the paragraph. Most of the reading app, text-based apps and blog, books etc. doesn’t justify text for ergonomic reasons. I can understand it is a matter of taste, so I suggest to add the option between `left`,`justify`.

title: adds initial Spanish translation
body:
Hello. I'm submitting the strings.xml file for an initial Spanish translation. Please review and merge if possible. If something should be changed first let me know.

Thanks.

title: Limit the number / size of locally stored articles
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
I have a lot of articles saved in my read-it-later service (currently: almost 5,000) and fetching all of those to my android phone and storing them locally would require more storage than I have.

Being able to limit the number of articles (or the storage-space used) synchronized to the Android application would be great.

A couple of bonuses would be :
- Being able to choose between "only synchronize most recent posts" (my favorite) and "only synchronize oldest posts" (and maybe, in addition, "always synchronize favorites" ? )
- Being able to force-purge oldest posts stored locally, to fore-synchronize most-recent ones (to always have the most-recent posts in the application, even if it means purging older ones, to respect the limit)

Disclaimer: I'm currently using another read-it-later service and I have not migrated to wallabag yet -- that's one of the features I use in their app ;-)

title: Wrong article counter during import from Pocket
body:
Hi there,
Well, I am trying to test the bug #97 and once again noticed that Framabag Wallabag inconsistently treats my Pocket article list. While in fact it has 504 articls, Wallabag import recognizes 1010 there, which is obviously wrong.
This is Pocket file in question (extension changed to TXT for compliance with Github)
[ril_export.txt](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/files/147711/ril_export.txt)

title: Error uploading links stored off-line
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
I share links to Wallabag often when I don't have a network connection, and then I upload them later. Today this failed - without any further explanation. I had two links stored off-line, and apparently uploading the first one failed. It looks like uploading the second one was not even attempted.

A bit later I added another link off-line. Now I have three links to upload, but since the first one fails, I am stuck. Worse, it looks like all further links I will store off-line will be lost, because I cannot upload them.

Conclusions:
1. If an upload fails, the remaining off-line links should be uploaded nevertheless.
2. It would be nice to know _why_ a link upload failed.
3. It would be nice to be able to remove the offending link, to restore normal operation.

Tested with Wallabag for Android version 1.9.3 and a Framabag account.

The main issue I have is that I cannot send my offline links to my my server. At first, it worked, and now I always have the fail message. Is there a way to retreive them simply?

title: webview with doc.wallabag.org
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body: As an iframe :-), we can embed our documentation into the Android app.

title: Display the base URL for syncing on the config page
body:
_From @khinsen on November 13, 2015 11:15_

Mobile apps that want to sync with Wallabag need a URL pointing to a Wallabag instance. It is not always obvious to a user what this URL must be. As I [found out](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/118) trying to configure the Android app, Wallabag instances on Framabag require `/u/username` as part of the URL, whereas I had expected this postfix to be appended by the Android app (after all, it asks me for my username).

The most reliable source for the base URL is the server, so I suggest displaying it on the config page, right next to the feed token.

_Copied from original issue: wallabag/wallabag#1514_

title: Cannot set “Accept all SSL certificates” on first configuration
body:
I have an account on a self-hosted instance with a CAcert certificate (waiting to migrate to Let's Encrypt).

When first configuring the application, it refused to connect with the message mentioned in #151. I tried checking the “Accept all SSL certificates” option, but the error remains. I tried restarting the app, as mentioned next to the check-box but, as the app couldn't connect, the “Save” button is inhibited, and the state of the option is not saved.

This is a bit of a chicken-and-egg problem where I need a valid connection to be able to save the SSL-acceptance option and put it in force, but I need for it to be in force to be abe to establish a valid connection.

title: Feature request: Proxy support
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Hello,

I was wondering if it was possible to add proxy support to this app's setting so it could access a wallabag instance hosted on I2P, TOR, etc. This would allow users to self host wallabag behind a NAT at home (or somewhere they don't control the network).

Thanks,
Simon

title: URL issue with badly processed wallabag links
label: [Label(name="Awaiting response"), Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
I added a link to wallabag as text (starting directly with domain name, eg _boingboing.net_) through the android app and therefore the URL was saved as so. 
When it got synced back to the app the domain shown on unread panel wasn't filtered to domain name, and the menu item or the link on top of the article to go to original URL led to NULL, and therefore crashed the app when followed.

TODO : Even if it's also a server issue, fix domain filtering [here](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/blob/master/app/src/main/java/fr/gaulupeau/apps/Poche/data/ListAdapter.java#L72) and [there](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/blob/master/app/src/main/java/fr/gaulupeau/apps/Poche/data/ListAdapter.java#L72) in that case (add the `http://` part if needed). 
Also, when sending URL, be sure that's it's a correct URL (I don't know how wallabag v2 handles this kind of things).

title: PayPal Giving Fund
body:
Hey there,

are you registered in the PayPal Giving Fund? I was not able to find you there.
When you enroll you do not have to pay fees when you get money. It is also possible to support you in the Humble Bundle / Store. Thank you very much.

I wish everyone a very Merry Christmas and a wonderful Happy New Year!

title: Support for TLS 1.2
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Hi,

I am running my own instance of wallabag on a hardened nginx server. As the only protocol version allowed is 1.2, I am not able to use the android app, as it looks like android defaults to (only) 1.0, if not demanded otherwise.

I think that I found the "problematic" line here, but as I am not an android dev, the problem might exist somewhere else:
https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/blob/master/app/src/main/java/fr/gaulupeau/apps/Poche/network/WallabagConnection.java#L127

By changing the parameter to "TLSv1.2" (See https://developer.android.com/reference/javax/net/ssl/SSLContext.html#getInstance%28java.lang.String%29), well, TLS 1.2 should be working, but I can not estimate what would get broken by that, as a higher API-Level might be required.

I hope that TLS 1.2 gets supported soon, if it is possible.

Greetings,
Amarandus

title: Flags while offline
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Currently the client complains if the device is offline and the user interacts with the documents (mark read, fav, ...). IMHO wallabag is designed for offline usage (on travel, ...) so it would be nice, if the user could also do the essential actions while he isn't online

P.S: Anyway it's working and simple to use. Thanks for the client and server :+1:

title: Use background Service for network operations
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Use Service or IntentService for all network operations (especially important for feed update operations).
#7 requires it. Related to other issues.

title: Rewrite position restoration
body:
Should probably fix #178.
Also apply font size setting before article loading.

title: Scroll position restored based on wrong height
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body: It looks like the position of an article is stored if the back button is pressed, but if I switch to another app and don't come back right away the reading position is back at the top after the app reopens.

A bit more logging in feed updater.
Bump okhttp version (not required, but why not).

Hi,

I have a Yunohost instance which has a Wallabag instance : ril.krands.be (_ril_ for _Read It Later_).
When I log in the Android app, it says that the `URL is not found`.

The user ID is entered and the token, generated and pasted.

While I tried everything I could, I don't know where the problem is from : the app or the way to log in Yuhonost's Wallabag.

Cheers !

title: HTML link appear too bold and underlined
label: [Label(name="Awaiting response"), Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
Reading an article on the app is cool (by the way, great to have the "Save in Wallabag" option now!), but HTML links appear too bold and underlined. I think it could be nicer to have a different color to indicate links (not underline, and not bold).

I agree it's a matter of taste, but I have the impression that it's becoming a standard (look at Github for example).

Server: Framabag
App : 1.9.3.1

title: Adding Link from In-App Doesn't Trigger Refresh

body:
If I click on a link and pick 'add to wallabag', I've now saved it in my list.
If I then go "back", though, I won't see the items I just added until I refresh.

title: [1.9.3.1] Save first on first call but then no longer works
body:

I would say it worked in 1.9.1 or 1.9.2 but no longer works since 1.9.3.*

Let me know how I can provide more details (logs ?) if necessary.

Thanks,
Nicolas

Hello

The recent wallabag app is great and it is so much better than the previous version.

I am using it on my android eink device. It  is all good however these areas might help even further
- [x] page down/up button support (implementation: an option to scroll by pressing on screen sides)

thanks

title: [1.9] Screen blocked after saving a URL
body:
Since the latest beta update (done yesterday), I observe the following behavior when saving URLs:
1. I tap "share" in some app (tested with TweetCaster and gReader Pro)
2. I select Wallabag.
3. Wallabag confims with the popup "added".
4. The screen is blocked, I cannot interact with the initial app any more.
5. When I tap the "back" button on my phone, operation is back to normal.

title: Updates
body:
- Fix #155.
- Add a message box suggesting to input username and passwords on first launch (for users who updated the app from an old version and might not see new settings). Now that I think about it, maybe I should also do something with the other welcome dialog... Anyway, that's better than nothing for now.
- Redirect user from `BagItProxyActivity` to main activity in order to see the message box mentioned above (for users without username entered and for the first time only).
- Don't attempt sync back to server if username is empty (and don't show related errors).
- Update localization a bit.

The PR should also [partially] solve #154, #150.

title: Check user credentials before performing network actions
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Do not try to push to a server "mark as read", "mark as favorite", etc. info if _optional_ credentials are not filled in. Maybe suggest user to fill in these parameters (though, since these are considered optional, maybe show suggestion for the first time only).

Check other cases when incomplete settings may cause ambiguous errors.

BTW, optionality of username and password breaks "Bag page" function (it is possible to fallback to old method of adding URLs via browser). But I presume for most of the users it won't be a problem to fill in username and password. Hence, **low priority**.

title: Fix NPE in case of null username or password
body:
Should fix #148.
More credentials checks should be added in the future (to advice user to check settings rather than saying about network/authorization errors).

title: Explain how to setup Wallabag for the first time
Use a PreferenceScreen for settings instead of regular view
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]

title: Experimental updates
body:
Added options to increase/decrease font size and change font family to ReadArticleActivity options menu.
The change of these parameters implemented via JavaScript calls. Unfortunately, after every change we have to adjust reading position (that was implemented the same way as position restoration on article load, since I couldn't find any new hook).
All of that is kind of experimental technique.

Two points worth mentioning:
- Initial font size and font family are applied **after** the article is loaded (I'm not into HTML+CSS, so I don't know if there is a robust way to set it before loading (**and** don't break the ability to change these parameters after loading)).
- I have no idea how to adjust font parameters correctly, so I just change style on "body" element. I presume somebody else can fix that.

title: Updates
body:
- Better themes support (all activities; theme selection from list; better colors).
- Serif typeface for article fonts as an option (was: inconsistent, depending on main/nightmode.css).
- Font size for articles fonts option.

I'm not into CSS, so improvements are very welcome.
Font setting implementation is plain stupid, but, well, you are free to replace it anytime.

Update: icons color for dark themes **was not** fixed in this update.

title: [1.9] on article view, put domain back
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: When I'm reading an article, I want to know the URL and open this article in my browser (if the article is not fetched correctly).

title: [1.9] add a contextual menu on each entry
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body: When I do a long click on an entry, I want to see a contextual menu with "archive", "mark as fav", "delete" actions.

title: [1.9 beta4] in parameters, focus is set to URL
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
When I display the parameters page, the focus is instantly set to URL field, so the keyboard is instantly displayed. 
When I display this page, I don't want to see the keyboard.

title: [1.9 beta4] loader stays visible if no connection
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body: I tried to refresh my list without internet connection, but the loader stays visible.

title: Adjust dark themes
label: [Label(name="Bug"), Label(name="UI")]
body:
- missing pictures (starred / archived entries)
- notification popin (`please check your connection` and others) is grey with dark background. I think it should be better if we remove dark background

title: Adjust swipe in ArticleView
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Swipe/fling should be adjusted for different screen sizes/densities.
Also address [this](https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/pull/124#issuecomment-156828863).

title: minor code optimization for the dark theme #108
body: I've just replaced the Boolean wrapper (like in the SettingsActivity)

title: Dark theme #108 added
body:
The commit b159155 contains the dark theme/night view #108 

commit 8a3fca3 should be ignored (only a gradle.build update).
I've added my app.iml -> should be ignored too

title: Updates
body:
- Fixed #129 
- Fixed #130 
- Fixed #125 

The last one turned out to be more complex than I thought. I made most of the async tasks to show error dialogs properly, and I can only hope I did not introduce new bugs. Anyway, sooner or later all that background work should be reorganized (using Services and IntentServices), so it should be fine for now.

title: Favorite panel has wrong order
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body: On favorite list, unread articles are shown in priority before archived articles. The previous/next buttons and swipe events work properly.

title: Add toast message to warn there's no previous/next article
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: When swiping through articles, warn if there's no more available.

title: [1.9] Slow URL upload
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
When I have a slow network connection, uploading a URL can take up to a minute, with the phone unusable during that time. Other read-later apps (Pocket, Instapaper) do the upload in the background.

A simple solution would be to store all URLs locally all the time, as if there were no network connection. This could be an option in the settings as it probably doesn't please everyone.

title: [1.9] Combine URL upload and sync
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
I don't see any good reason to have the upload of locally stored URLs as a separate operation that must be launched manually. I'd expect this to be part of the sync operation. It should first upload the locally stored URLs, and then download articles via the RSS stream.

Moreover, I'd appreciate an option to sync automatically when the app is started.

title: Updates
body:
- Add Basic HTTP Auth support. #20 
- Add switching between articles with "fling" action. #122 

I'm pretty sure HTTP Auth won't break anything, but I'm also **not** sure it currently works (feeds + network commands will probably work; web-content (images from server) may not work (the code to support it is added, but not debugged)).

Swipe/fling action works, but may need some tuning (especially on screens with different size/density).

title: button to create an account from the app
label: [Label(name="Awaiting response"), Label(name="Feature")]
body: If nothing is configured, I want to see a button to create a account on framabag

title: navigate between articles
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body: When I'm reading an article, I want to swipe to read the next article.

title: Estimatedreadingtime
body: See #111

title: Updates
body:
- Fix icons appearing/disappearing.
- Show relevant icons for each list.
- Improve "connection test" due to issues like #118

title: Swipe views and some other updates
body:
- Swipe views for "Unread", "Favorite" and "Archived" lists.
- A little update for prev/next buttons: thee buttons now honor context (e.g. if article was opened in "favorites" list, the buttons will move though articles in "favorites" list (well, I hope they would)).
- Minor changes.

Full/fast sync explanation:
Well, there is no actual _synchronization_, only one-way _update_.
"Update all feeds" option in menu starts full update (wipes DB, successively updates "Unread", "Archived" and "Favorites" feeds). There are no more other update options in menu.
In each list (in the mentioned swipe views) pull-to-refresh starts update for the corresponding feed.
For "Favorite" and "Archived" feeds it's pretty easy: read all feed and update local entries.
For "Unread" feed update has a little hack: it reads feed and adds new entries, but stops as soon as it encounters an article with the same articleId it has locally. It allows quickly load recently added articles (though, it won't load some old moved-from-archive article). This is previously so called "Fast sync". This also is the default behavior for pull-to-refresh for "Unread" feed. I probably should make it optional.

title: [1.9] Can't sync
body:
I just signed up for the beta testing program and installed the new app. Then I configured it for my Framabag account. Result: "Erreur de traitement du flux" (my phone is configured in French).

Of course I checked all my configuration info (login, password, user ID, token) ten times. I also regenerated a new token and double-checked it. No chance.

In the "settings" dialog, the connection test works fine, but the one for obtaining the RSS info leads to an error message.

title: Navigations between saved articles
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Suppose that I saved both articles
- http://server.com/a.html
- http://server.com/b.html
  in Wallabag.

It would be really nice if a link from a.html to b.html in the server is translated to a link inside the Wallabag app (note that that I dont 'ask the same thing as Issue #43 ).

Best.

title: Some updates
body:
- Includes #98 (which is based on "master" branch)
- Merged into "dev" branch
- Some improvements for FeedUpdater
- Article reading position save and restore (especially useful in case of screen orientation change)
- Minor changes

title: Major update
body:
So.. the initial goal of this was to make selecting articles as read sync back to the server.

Then things got kind of hairy. Wallabag's article id fro the server was not present in the local DB. DB interactions is all handcrafted.

To make things easier to work with and since there has been no big updates in a while, I decided to make some changes. These changes are breaking, but that should be no big deal since everything lives on the server anyway, just resync.

To make DB things less manual, greenDAO is used to handle all that, which makes things less easy to break by mistake. The FeedUpdater have been extended to store article ids, not just the internal id.

To make it possible to actually sync selecting articles as read, username and password is now settings to. Since that is done by first signing in and then issue a request to `/?action=toggle_archive&id=<article_id>`. To make this less painful OkHttp is now used instead of the regular HTTP client. As a result of now having login info, adding articles is now automated also, instead of the browser bounce.

Also, to separate code, the share action is now broken out to BagItProxyActivity.

I might have missed some things here, but most of the transitioning things are made in https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/commit/3dd80c032cd7eae74eac149c8208d89b9774219d.

This is a changeset against the master branch. While writing this I also just realized that there was a dev branch with a few changes. Those would probably be pretty easy merged in to this as well.

title: Scroll position restoration in ReadArticle
body:
Store/restore scroll position in/from local DB.

Restoring position after WebView's loaded is kinda [tricky](http://stackoverflow.com/a/7011229).

Position may be not so accurate on screen orientation change (probably because of text realignment).

title: Add french translations
body:
- new attempt to add french translations
- code refactoring

title: Added a dark theme option for bed-time reading.
body:
Issue  https://github.com/wallabag/android-app/issues/13
Night reading mode.

Remark:
Because of the API 8 compability, a restart is needed to take the dark theme in effect 
(recreate() is only available from API 11 on).

title: Remember position in partially read article
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body: Often, I decide to stop reading in the middle of a long article and look at something else (in wallabag). But when I go back to the long article, it opens it at the beginning, not in the middle. I guess it's not possible to have this synced with the server, but it would be nice if it was at least local on the phone.

title: added spanish locale
body: Added spanish translation, there seem to be still some strings that are hardcoded, or missing from the strings.xml file. Independent developper willing to contribute.

title: updated some strings so they sound nicer
body: A few updates to the text, to make it more obvious to new users. Also updated the copyright mention.

title: offline add article
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Needs wallabag v2 API")]
body: it would be very usefull if the wallabag app didn't need to have a network connection to add a new article. this means that sharing with the wallabag app only would make an entry in the app that is synchronized to wallabag server the next time the phone goes online. so it could be used with a newsreader without having network connection, e.g. in the subway.

title: rename « mark as read » to « delete locally »
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
To avoid confusions since archive function can't be synced.

source : http://support.wallabag.org/discussions/questions/50-how-can-i-use-the-wallabag-archive-function

title: App Install Location
body:
The internal memory of my device is quite small, this PR should allow users to easily move the app to the microSD.

"To allow the system to install your application on the external storage, modify your manifest file to include the android:installLocation attribute in the element, with a value of either "preferExternal" or "auto"." (source: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/install-location.html)

Thank you very much for your awesome app :)

title: Added Google play and F-Droid Badges
App Install Location
body:
The internal memory of my device is quite small, this PR should allow users to easily move the app to the microSD.

"To allow the system to install your application on the external storage, modify your manifest file to include the android:installLocation attribute in the element, with a value of either "preferExternal" or "auto"." (source: https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/install-location.html)

Thank you very much for your awesome app :)

title: High contrast
body:
Just so this is not lost: This PR tweaks the article CSS a bit to force high-contrast colours. This is useful on e-ink readers such as the Nook, where text is otherwise a bit hard to read sometimes. This is done by adding the relevant CSS class to the article.

At the moment, this is done only if a Nook is detected. This should probably be done in the settings somewhere, or at list with a list of known devices.

So, not a very functional patch at this point (though it doesn't break anything), but it can prove a useful thing to have in the future.

title: uncomplet note fails to sync
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body: after having importing note from pocket, so of them are not completly imported, so when i use the android app to finish to sync the notes i failed because of my proxy settings. As i'm using Tor (to say everything;) we cant sync note without dealing with proxy

title: Clearer error messages in case of incorrect wallabag URL
label: [Label(name="Improvement"), Label(name="Legacy")]
body:
Originally posted at https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/1212

> When I entered an invalid wallabag url from the settings on my android, I got the error :
> error loading feed .
> Got invalid response
> followed by the html source code of the main page of https://framabag.org/
> I mean the app does not display the home page but (i insist) the HTML source code.
> 
> The reason is that I forgot to fill the /u/username after https://framabag.org/
> 
> I tested to put https://framabag.org/u/foobarfoobar but when I save setting I get 404
> So when we put https://framabag.org/ instead, as it's not a 404 error, later when synchronizing we face that issue.
> 
> May be we can handle a clearer error to avoid to make us confused ;)

title: Video support
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
First of all, thanks for this application.

I saved a YouTube video and I can watch it wallabag via the web browser, but when I try to watch it via the Android application, I get an "Unable to execute Javascript" error. It would be really nice if the application supported inline video so that I don't have to open the web browser to view them.

Leads to "301: Moved permanently" error pop-up.

title: Read the article with text2speech
body: Give the possibly to Read the article with text2speech.

title: Locally download/cache pictures
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: They aren't displayed when offline.

title: FC with Fliktu sharing app
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
An user having the [Fliktu sharing app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.oakstar.fliktu&hl=en) emailed me because wallabag was having FC while trying to save a link. That's what he discovered : 

> Basically, it replaces the share menu by having you select it as default. The best I could tell, the issue arose because when you choose to “bag it”, the share menu pops up a second time asking which browser to use. Since Fliktu was selected as my default browser — but is not, in fact, a browser — Wallabag would crash. 
> I went ahead and made a browser the default for the wallabag action, and now all is well — even with Fliktu engaged.

This should be put in some sort of FAQ while wallabag v2 comes out and the android app be updated.

title: Articles are (sometimes ?) sorted without any order
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
It doesn't shows latest articles at first or at the bottom and I don't recognize any pattern. Do articles are written asynchronously in local database ?

[NOTE : Providing the pubDate or another element in RSS feeds as the date when the article was saved might help]

title: Localize the app
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Ideas to easily translate an app ? Is the system now used is good ?

How can we translate ? Just in res/values-xx ?

title: use article list as root activity
body:
I started to work on #70. It's not done yet, but the basic functionality should be ready.  
Currently there's only a reload button (without any activity-indicator) instead of pull-to-refresh, but I think it's good for testing already.

title: Add UI to share articles (dev branch)
body: Ass per #62.

title: UI: Display list of articles by default, move front buttons to menu
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Once configured, one will more generally start the app to read articles. The front screen with the buttons is therefore a bit useless, and delays accessing the articles.

I think it would make sense to move these buttons to the soft menu of the article list (maybe with the sync button in the ActionBar), and present that first.

title: Share intent adds site directly without opening browser, supports HTTP Auth too

Also, disable lint abortOnError so the build completes despite
getActionBar().setDisplayHomeAsUpEnabled(true) calls (properly protected
by conditions on the API version in the code).

title: Add Poche::getDatabase to prevent overwriting reference, leading to a leak
body:
NOTA: This is not thoroughly tested, but this seems to fix the problem, while not causing any other.

Fixes the following exception

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: /data/data/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche/databases/article_db.sqlite SQLiteDatabase created and never closed
```

Signed-off-by: Olivier Mehani shtrom@ssji.net

title: Add UI to share articles
body:
This adds a menu option to share the article current being read through a
standard Android Intent.

The share option will show up in the ActionBar if space is available.

The shared form is similar to that of the webapp, with title in the subject, and
“URL via @wallabagapp” in the body of the intent.

title: How to setup Wallabag Android when using Framabag?
body:
Hi,

I just set up an account on Framabag, and wanted to use the Android app on my device... except I have no idea how to configure it, and I could not find any documentation anywhere to help me do so.

So, if using Framabag, what do I have to put in the different fields (`Wallabag URL`, `User ID`, `Token`)?

It would be good to explain this in Wallabag documentation as well I think...

Thanks in advance for your feedback!

title: Support for ebook reader (i.e. Sony PRS T1)
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
I've got an old ebook reader (Sony PRS T1) which is running Android.
I have succeeded in installing wallabag on my ebook and have synchronized my contents with my own installation of Wallabag. Unfortunately, the app does not handle physical button and.pagination is not smooth. It is not usable with my reader.

Do you know a compatible ebook reader with wallabag ? 

thanks,
Happy new year,

title: Where does the app save synced articles?
body: I had to wipe my Server but have all my wallabag articles synced to my Phone. Now I wonder if there is a way to transfer them from my phone back to my new wallabag-server.

title: article view improvements
body:
> OK, I've tested it.
> Some remarks :
> - can you decrease the size of the title now displayed on the action bar, in order to show a little more text
> - I think you should keep the Mark as read button at the bottom, even though the other is practical
> - Can it be possible to have an icon for the new mark at read button, instead of this kind of menu ?

i've added back the button below the content. The upper one is now a button with an image (it's a system icon, we can change it, if we have a better one), see screenshot:
![checkmark](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4399446/5460600/6b051eba-8564-11e4-97cc-76f75bd9627a.png)

I'll look at the first remark tomorrow, but it shouldn't be a big deal to decrease the font size.

title: Offline images
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
o/

I use wallabag only in the Paris subway, with almost no internet connectivity, everything work well but images don't.

Images are not cached while synchronizing, so I can't view them offline, and sometime, it hurts the readability of an article to miss pictures. So an option synchronize them too may be cool for me.

title: Sticky mark as read
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
o/

Sometime, after reading a few lines, I don't want to read more. Still the "mark as read" is sometimes far, far away at the bottom of the article.

It may be cool for me to have an always-available mark-as-read button.

title: Invalid URL using share > wallabag in Twitter
body:
I'm on Android 4.2.2. 
My Wallabag is self hosted. When I try to add a page using "share > bag it ! " in my browser (Firefox or Opera) on Android, no problem. 
But when I try to use the "Share > Wallabag" button in Twitter, it launch my browser, then ask me to connect to my Wallabag page, then end up with a white page saying "Invalid URL supplied". When I look at the server logs, the URL seems indeed different : there are special characters such as %, that I don't find in URL added via the "bag it" button.

title: when reading an article: add action "save to wallabag" to a link
label: [Label(name="Needs wallabag v2 API")]
body: this is currently on of my most used features when reading articles in pocket. an article often contains links to other articles which I want to add quickly to my link list (pocket is my link list containing thousends of articles). Would be good to add this feature also to wallabag app, together with the feature to add links without using the web browser.

title: Sorting modes of article list
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
- [x] by creation date.
- [ ] by update date.
- [ ] by estimated reading time.
- [ ] by name (alphabetical).

title: filter articles as in the web: favorites, archive, tags, ...
label: [Label(name="Needs wallabag v2 API")]

title: add actions to articles (mark as read, starring, tag, ...) as in the web client
label: [Label(name="Needs wallabag v2 API")]
body:
a minimum support of actions for articles is required when wallabag should be used for offline reading (and also online reading) on android. At least: mark article as read, delete, mark with a star. 

tagging support would be fine but could be implemented in the next step.

title: add articles without web browser, and also when offline
label: [Label(name="Needs wallabag v2 API")]
body:
currently links can be added only when online and only via the web browser. And it takes some time. 

I suggest to implement a way to collect the links which should be added in the app and to sync them to the server when synchronizing articles. Otherwise the app can't be used to add links when offline or with a bad connection. This would also save a lot of time when sharing links to wallabag.

To get some ideas have a look on the pocket app and how it works. Btw, I started to use pocket when I was without mobile internet (for example in a rooming situation) and a good offline support was the main reason to start to use it.

title: not able to share from feedly-app to wallabag
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
I would like to test wallabag as an alternative to pocket. wallabag has a free full text search. But I am not able to share links from androids feedly app to wallabag on my android device. something is shared, but the link is invalid and can't be used.

when I click on the "link to the original" I get something like file:///android_asset/a_long_name_without_a_website

When I look at the link in wallabag web client, it looks like:
https://www.framabag.org/u/aisberg/Andreas%20Popp%20%E2%80%93%20Kapitalismus%20vs.%20Demokratie%20http://pinksliberal.wordpress.com/2014/10/04/andreas-popp-kapitalismus-vs-demokratie

and the content is also not shown.
but when I copy the contained link
http://pinksliberal.wordpress.com/2014/10/04/andreas-popp-kapitalismus-vs-demokratie
then this link works. 

When I share a link in the browser to wallabag-app, it works fine. I think feedly addes something which will not be resolved by wallabag-app.

Normally I never use the feedly share function, but I use ifttt service to push marked articles from feedly to pocket, but there is not yet a wallabag channel on ifttt. So I can't use feedly this way.

title: Added regular expression to extract the URL from the pageUrl sent by oth...
body: ...er apps in the intent. This was done primarily because some apps (like Duckduckgo) send a string with an URL in the middle and when sending to the web app the parsing of that string fails.

title: No error message if nonexistent / invalid user id is used
label: [Label(name="Bug")]
body:
I falsely assumed that user ID is the username when i setup wallabag for the first time and didn't check it (token etc. was right). 

There was never an error that there is no such ID or that my username is in fact no number.

So i might "lost" several articles (which i wallabagged on android) because there was no error message. 

Would be great if wallabag checked if the ID is an existent number or throw an error. :)

title: fixes for release
body:

- added german localization  
- added back button into actionBar

title: Accessing "List Articles" before end of sync makes list incomplete
label: [Label(name="Bug")]

title: improving article display, improving style (updating theme)
body:
- ported the project to [Android Studio](http://developer.android.com/sdk/installing/studio.html) (better building system, better editor)  
- articles are stored with their original HTML (as it was stored as plain text)  
- use a webView with stylesheets to display the articles (+ working images, +working links ...) (used stylesheets from iOS app)  
- replaced "In the poche" with "wallabag" in all images and text occurrences  
- improved layout (latest theme for ~ every Android Version)

title: Problem parsing the package on Nook Simple Touch (SDK #7/Android 2.1)
body:
I am trying to install 1.5.3.2 on a Nook Simple touch (Glow worm, running Android 2.1), but get an error saying

```
There was an problem parsing the package
```

Investigating the logcat, I see the following error:

```
I/ActivityManager(  777): Starting activity: Intent { act=android.intent.action.VIEW dat=file:///sdcard/download/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche_8_5.apk typ=application/vnd.android.package-archive cmp=com.android.packageinstaller/.PackageInstallerActivity }
W/ResourceType(22502): Bad string block: last string is not 0-terminated
W/PackageParser(22502): /sdcard/download/fr.gaulupeau.apps.InThePoche_8_5.apk (at Binary XML file line #5): Requires newer sdk version #8 (current version is #7)
```

Is there an actual dependency on SDK version 8 (and Android 2.2), or would it be possible to re-build the package with a lower version (7) of the SDK so it could run on the Nook?

title: HTTP authentication support

title: Trim leading spurious text in intent extra data
body: This allows sharing to work from feedly.

title: Use api.php to use crude RPC to post links
body:
This change set does two things.

1) Uses the api.php "API" to post urls without requiring the user to interact with the browser.
2) Trims leading garbage (the link title in Feedly's case) that precedes the link in the sharing intent's extra data so that it works with Feedly.

Enjoy!

title: Soft menu missing
body:
Hi there,

I've recently updated my phone to Android KitKat and the soft menu has disappeared from the app (the one for settings and purge DB). Thanks to a backup application (Titanium Backup) I could restore my settings but I cannot modify them neither purge the DB so my reading list is growing despite I do read a lot :)
I could reproduce the bug on my wife's phone also on KitKat.

Anybody has the same issue and a possible a workaround ?

title: let list remember where it was and restore this position when coming bac...
body: when browsing the list remember the current position when selection an article. when coming back to the list, restore that position. For me, that gives me are more natural behaviour of the list.

title: Night reading mode with light text on dark background
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body: The Android app should have a day and a night reading mode, with the latter being white text on black background (with options to change text and background color ina range of lighter text and dark background colors). See Pocket, Pulse, the OwnCloud NewsReader App and others as examples. Maybe some code for this could be lifted from FBreader https://github.com/geometer/FBReaderJ which has a great night mode.

title: Android app: make share intent add site to app, not launch web app
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Currently when using the Firefox share menu to add sites to Poche, the web interface is opened.

This is strange since the intent comes from the app. Also it's annoying since I want to either continue reading the page or close it - Poche should not distract the flow.

Hence, the link should rather be added to the Poche app in the background. with just a vanishing notification that it did so, much like Pocket does.

See https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/412

title: Android app: outdated interface
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
The app looks like it was made for Android 2.x – maybe better use the Holo stuff to make it look current. ;)

See https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/403

title: Android app: automatic sync
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
Currently people need to manually synchronize their Poche. This should be automatic in the background. If at all, something like pull-to-refresh in the list.

Also, the list of the actual articles should be the primary view, since that’s the important part.

See https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/404

title: Android app: no means to copy
body:
In the Android app it’s not possible to copy anything. No link or image, it’s not even possible to get to the original source of the link in the browser (or at least I couldn’t find a way).

I expected to be able to click the header to get to the original article in a browser, for example. Or have a menu much like for the web interface.

See https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/405

title: Text to Speech (android)
label: [Label(name="Feature")]
body:
It really needs text to speech option . This is my favourite feature of pocket on android. Great to listen to articles at the gym. TTS engines like IVONA are really very fluent these days and can read very humanly with excellent intonation.

See https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/263

title: [Feature request] Use QR codes to set the mobile applications up
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Needs wallabag v2 API")]
body:
Adding the id and token manually to the application was a bit frustrating. It would be great if we could just generate a QR code from the settings that the mobile application could scan to fill the fields up.

See https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/432

title: Android app: support for self-signed certificate
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
The android app does not seem to be able to complete https requests when the server has self-signed certificate. Please support self-signed certs, as a lot of self-hosters will have one :-)

See wallabag/wallabag#418

title: logged web browser
body:
Obligation to logged in via the web browser and not via the application
translate via google translate

title: Quelques suggestions
label: [Label(name="Improvement")]
body:
Salut !
2 suggestions pour l'application mobile.
- l'estimation du temps de lecture (comme la version web)
- Le partage sur shaarli.
  Voilà voulou.
